chapter.title: Using cards for reporting
chapter.section:
To create milestones, releases and iterations reports (such as burnups and burndowns) easily, represent milestones, releases and iterations as cards and use these cards to create and view metrics and charts.
For example:
create release and iteration specific burnups and burndowns using the Daily History Chart or Data Series Chart
see the number of stories planned for the release by creating a Stack bar chart
see release specific feature breakup and completion status of stories by creating a Ratio bar chart

Using a card as a representation of an Iteration or Release means that it is easier to roll up your metrics on that card to give easily accessible 'Iteration' or 'Release' level reports.
By adding your card to a tree you can create aggregate properties that can summarize data about children cards. As the status of the children card changes the aggregate properties are also updated automatically so the Release metrics are always up to date.
Create card specific charts easily by using THIS CARD to reference the card the charts they are being displayed on.
By adding your desired cards (as well as using THIS CARD) to your card defaults any new cards of that type will automatically have card specific charts created.
